items.title: Vervolgstap De Busser: 'Je zou Ajax kunnen noemen'
items.summary: In Rondje Eurojackpot KNVB Beker blikken Tim Reedijk, Lentin Goodijk en Inta Janssen terug op de penaltyreeks bij de wedstrijd tussen Go Ahead Eagles en Heracles Almelo, waarin wie anders dan Jari De Busser weer uitblonk.

items.title: Rode kaart tegen AZ kost Wijndal resterende Eredivisie-duels van januari
items.summary: Owen Wijndal is naar aanleiding van zijn rode kaart in het bekerduel met AZ voor twee duels geschorst. Ajax kan in de aankomende competitieduels met Go Ahead Eagles en FC Volendam daardoor geen beroep doen op de 26-jarige linksback.

items.title: Spurs take Moersen from City Football Group as director of football operations
items.summary: Moersen to serve months of gardening leave Major part of new role will involve women‚Äôs setup Tottenham have appointed Carlos Raphael Moersen as their first director of football operations, taking him from City Football Group, which oversees a stable of clubs including Manchester City. Moersen, known as Rafi, will not join until before the summer transfer window because he is on gardening leave. He has spent more than a decade at CFG, serving most recently as director of football transactions. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Juventus op de transfervrije toer, PSG heeft oogje op Chelsea-speler'
items.summary: De tijd van winterse versterkingen is aangebroken, in dit blog volgen we alle transferactiviteit in het buitenland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in Nederland.

items.title: Half miljard aanvragen WK-tickets: 'Dit is een wereldwijd signaal'
items.summary: Nu de inschrijfdeadline voor WK-tickets is verlopen, heeft de FIFA de cijfers uit de doeken gedaan. In totaal waren er een half miljard aanvragen voor tickets voor het WK van komende zomer in Canada, Mexico en de Verenigde Staten.

items.title: Arbeloa: Madrid Copa exit to 2nd-tier side 'painful'
items.summary: New Real Madrid coach √Ålvaro Arbeloa took responsibility for the team's "painful" 3-2 Copa del Rey defeat to second-tier Albacete on Wednesday, defending his decision to rest a number of senior players.

items.title: Chelsea's Rosenior: Blame me for S√°nchez errors
items.summary: Liam Rosenior has urged Chelsea fans to blame him for Robert S√°nchez's two mistakes which helped Arsenal to a 3-2 victory in Wednesday's Carabao Cup semifinal, first leg at Stamford Bridge.

items.title: FIFA requests for World Cup tickets passes 500M
items.summary: FIFA said Wednesday it has received more than 500 million ticket requests for this year's World Cup.

items.title: Eto'o banned over alleged AFCON misbehavior
items.summary: Cameroonian Football Federation president Samuel Eto'o has been suspended for four games for alleged misbehavior during his team's loss to Morocco at the Africa Cup of Nations.

items.title: 'Situatie Wijndal is een reflectie van hoe het vaak fout gaat bij beleid Ajax'
items.summary: In Rondje Eurojackpot KNVB Beker blikken Lentin Goodijk, Tim Reedijk en Inta Janssen terug op de historische nederlaag van Ajax tegen AZ in de achtste finale. Owen Wijndal pakte rood tegen zijn oude club maar deed een n√≥g opvallendere uitspraak in zijn interview met ESPN.

items.title: Robertson keen to stay at Liverpool but 'wants to play football'
items.summary: Liverpool's Andy Robertson on contract talks, a "stressful summer" and why he "wants to play" rather than sit on the bench.

items.title: ‚ÄòA group of people decided to kill me‚Äô: Michel Platini on Fifa, Uefa and the fight to clear his name
items.summary: Former Uefa president ‚Äì caught between moving on and settling scores ‚Äì talks candidly about his downfall, Infantino and the snakepit of the game‚Äôs governance ‚ÄúThere are millions and millions of romantics in football,‚Äù Michel Platini says. He has been asked whether, after a decade frozen out of the game, its lustre has vanished for him. ‚ÄúMillions who share the ideas that I have. But in the end, it‚Äôs big business.‚Äù It is an industry whose peaks Platini scaled before, in one of football‚Äôs biggest falls from grace, it spat him out. He maintains he would have become Fifa president if he had not been banned from football over an alleged unlawful payment made to him in 2011, when he was running Uefa, by Sepp Blatter. The scandal led to a criminal case but both men were acquitted for a second time, definitively so, by a Swiss appeals court last year. Nothing hangs over Platini any more, bar a conviction that he was cheated. Continue reading...

items.title: Andy Robertson admits Liverpool future unclear with contract expiring in summer
items.summary: Defender frustrated by lack of playing time this season ‚ÄòWe need to see option to stay or if there‚Äôs options to go‚Äô Andy Robertson has said his Liverpool future remains unresolved despite his contract expiring in five months and admitted this season‚Äôs limited playing time has been a frustration. Liverpool have held talks over extending their vice-captain‚Äôs outstanding Anfield career but, with no firm offer on the table, Robertson‚Äôs next step is uncertain beyond competing in Scotland‚Äôs first World Cup for 28 years. The left-back, who turns 32 in March, turned down Atl√©tico Madrid last summer and is likely to have several options should he become a free agent. Continue reading...

items.title: Ratcliffe and Glazer family visit Manchester United training ground to support Carrick
items.summary: Executive meeting moved to meet with interim manager Mart√≠nez ‚Äòdidn‚Äôt want to play any more‚Äô after knee injury Sir Jim Ratcliffe and at least one of the Glazer family are at Manchester United‚Äôs training base on Thursday to support the interim manager, Michael Carrick, before Saturday‚Äôs derby with Manchester City. United were due to hold an executive committee meeting of senior management at a different location but this was moved to Carrington so that they could speak to Carrick before the first game of his second caretaker tenure. Continue reading...

items.title: Brave K√∂ln push Bayern but will it be enough to bring calm to Effzeh? | Andy Brassell
items.summary: Amid grumbles, a winless run and negative banners, there are signs of life for K√∂ln after a narrow loss to the champions We didn‚Äôt see this coming, and not only because of the fog of pyro lingering over the RheinEnergieSTADION field that furnished us with 11 minutes of first-half stoppage time. In October‚Äôs equivalent fixture in the DFB Pokal, K√∂ln had really rattled Bayern Munich in the first half and even taken the lead through Ragnar Ache ‚Äì and still ended up on the wrong end of a 4-1 scoreline. The world around Gei√übockheim has not been a particularly happy place since. Effzeh came into this Englische Woche on a run of seven games without a win, which was even harder to swallow after an extremely promising start. Worse still, head coach Lukas Kwasniok ‚Äì who started this season embracing the city and the club‚Äôs spirit with his wearing of replica shirts on the touchline ‚Äì was recently targeted by K√∂ln fans in Saturday‚Äôs draw at Heidenheim, with a banner reading ‚ÄúKwasni Yok‚Äù (‚Äúyok‚Äù being no in Turkish), credited to the Wilde Horde ultras group. Continue reading...

items.title: Buttler backs England to become world's No 1 Test team after Ashes flop
items.summary: Jos Buttler has backed Ben Stokes to lead England to the top of the Test rankings despite the side's 4-1 Ashes failure in Australia this winter.

items.title: Neville: Ancelotti, Tuchel or Pochettino for Man Utd next season - not Carrick
items.summary: Gary Neville says Michael Carrick must not be Manchester United manager at the start of next season, and has offered his three-man shortlist he would like installed instead.

items.title: Fernandes not seeking to leave Man Utd in January
items.summary: Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes is not planning to seek a move away from the club this month.
